required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Diagnostic Performance and Predictive Capacity of Immediate Urine Cytology After Transurethral Resection of Non-Muscle Invasive Bladder Cancer; A Prospective Study
clinical_study.official_title: Diagnostic Performance and Predictive Capacity of Immediate Urine Cytology After Transurethral Resection of Non-Muscle Invasive Bladder Cancer; A Prospective Study

brief_summary.textblock: The current study aimed at prospectively assessing the performance of IUC as a predictive tool for residual tumor after primary TURBT of NMIBC, and possible future recurrence.

detailed_description.textblock: The current study aimed at prospectively assessing the performance of IUC as a predictive tool for residual tumor after primary TURBT of NMIBC, and possible future recurrence.

primary_outcome.time_frame: It was assessed 48 hours after primary TURBT
primary_outcome.description: The primary outcome included assessment of the performance of IUC as a predictive tool for possible residual malignancy after primary TURBT. Thereafter, sensitivity (Sn), specificity (Sp), positive and negative predictive values (PPV, NPV) and overall accuracy of IUC as a preliminary step before repeat TURBT will be determined.

secondary_outcome.measure: The secondary outcome included the evaluation of predictive capacity of IUC for tumor recurrence in the study participants.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Within duration of follow up (4 years )
secondary_outcome.description: The secondary outcome included the evaluation of predictive capacity of IUC for tumor recurrence in the study participants.

arm_group.description: Patients with primary or recurrent NMIBC for whom complete TURBT was done.

intervention.description: Forty-eight hours after primary TURBT, IUC was retrieved and patients were scheduled for repeat TURBT 2 to 6 weeks later according to the predetermined protocol. The primary outcome was to determine the role of positive IUC to predict positive biopsy findings on repeat TURBT.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
-patients with primary or recurrent NMIBC for whom complete TURBT was done
Exclusion Criteria:
-Patients with concomitant CIS, upper tract urothelial tumors, biopsy proven muscle invasion, or low risk NMIBC (single, primary, Ta, G1 tumor).
